intro: Saposhnikovia seseloides, commonly known as Chinese angelica or huang qi, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hollow, aromatic stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are the primary part used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its medicinal properties.
